messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] for Mimi
messages.msgSnippet: What an amazing story Mimi, even though it is the second time you ve described it. I admire your hope and courage and strength that you have for your boys.
messages.messageBody:
What an amazing story Mimi, even though it is the second time you've described it. I admire your hope and courage and strength that you have for your boys.
Your story makes me remember to truly be thankful for every heathly and untroubled minute I am fortunate enough to have with my own 2 boys.
All the best to you and your family.

Karin



On Monday, December 17, 2001, groundhoggirl wrote:

One of my boys, Paul, was diagnosed with a rare form of Leukemia (JCML)
back in March 1999.

Paul's twin, Leroy, is a Juvenile Diabetic (Type I).

My 2 boys are the reasons why I support stem-cell research.

Sincerely,

Mimi


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
